Pope Clement VI was the fourth pope reigning from this city. During a namesake “captivity,” seven popes resided in this city due to conflict between one country and the papacy.

Clement VI issued one of these papal decrees affirming the “Sicut Judaeis” protections for Jews in the wake of the Black Plague. The latest of these decrees was issued by Pope Francis, announcing an “Extraordinary Jubilee of Mercy.”

bonuses.leadin: For 10 points each, answer some questions about Alexander the Great’s conquests.
bonuses.leadin_sanitized: For 10 points each, answer some questions about Alexander the Great's conquests.
parts: Alexander and his army besieged this island city for 7 months before building a causeway to capture it. Upon entering this city in modern-day Lebanon, Alexander’s forces destroyed half of it and sold thousands of residents into slavery.
At the Battle of Gaugamela, Alexander defeated the army of Darius III, the ruler of this empire. Darius was buried in Persepolis, the former capital of this empire.
Alexander faced off against King Porus and his war elephants at this battle on the namesake river. After winning this battle, Alexander annexed much of Punjab.

parts: 21 people were killed in this city in 1919 when a storage tank filled with 2.3 million gallons of molasses used in the production of alcohol and munitions burst in its North End.

bonuses.leadin: The 118th Congress had an eventful opening. For 10 points each:
bonuses.leadin_sanitized: The 118th Congress had an eventful opening. For 10 points each:
parts: The 118th Congress opened with this Republican congressman being elected speaker after 15 ballots in the longest speaker election since 1860 due to his inability to reconcile with the Freedom Caucus Republicans.

This Freedom Caucus member was nearly punched in the face by angry Republican Congressman Mike Rogers following his refusal to vote for McCarthy for Speaker. This politician was previously the subject of a federal child sex trafficking investigation in connection with now-incarcerated tax collector Joel Greenberg.

Exact phrase required. One of the most controversial concessions in McCarthy’s deal with the Freedom Caucus was the rule that it would only require one member to propose this action, which would remove the Speaker.

bonuses.leadin: Sometimes the Supreme Court just can’t make up its mind. For 10 points each:

parts: Name this landmark Supreme Court case, which partially overturned an earlier abortion case by using an“undue burden” standard of review. This case was itself overturned by Dobbs v. Jackson Women’s Health Organization.

parts: Senghor served as the first president of this West African country for 20 years, and founded its Democratic Bloc with Mamadou Dia, prime minister of this country with capital at Dakar until imprisoned by Senghor on unproven charges.

Senghor, also a poet, was involved in this literary movement primarily of the francophone African diaspora, which resisted assimilation and highlighted Black culture and pride. This movement influenced Franz Fanon’s writing of The Wretched of the Earth.
Following his resignation as president and Senegal’s resulting transition towards democracy, Senghor became the first African elected to this council of “immortals” that oversees the French language.
